title: Emergency Plumbing
excerpt: Urgent leaks, sewer backups, and burst pipes handled by on-call techs 24/7.

hero.headline: Emergency plumbers who actually pick up the phone.
hero.subheadline: We dispatch licensed techs day or night with clear pricing and clean, respectful service.

problems: Burst pipes, failed shutoff valves, and flooding basements
Sewer line backups and overflows into tubs, showers, or floor drains
Broken water heaters leaking or shutting down before a busy day
Toilets overflowing or refusing to flush
symptoms: Water pooling near fixtures or walls humming with water noise
Sewer odors coming from drains or floor cleanouts
No water pressure or rusty water suddenly from taps
Constant cycling sump pump struggling to keep up
solutions: Rapid shutoff, damage mitigation, and stabilization of the situation
Camera inspection and mechanical clearing on main sewer backups
Emergency water heater repairs or temporary solutions until replacement
Clean removal of standing water and anti-bacterial cleaning recommendations
expectations: Live dispatcher who gathers the basics and routes the nearest tech
Arrival updates by text and a uniformed plumber with shoe covers
Straight talk on cause, options, and transparent pricing before work
Permanent fix when possible, or safe temporary repair until parts arrive

faqs.question: Do you charge extra for after-hours emergency calls?
faqs.answer: Emergency visits include a modest after-hours fee, but the diagnostic and repair rates stay the same. We waive the fee if you approve the recommended work.

faqs.question: How fast can you be on-site?
faqs.answer: Around Fortville, Fishers, and greater Indianapolis we typically arrive within 90 minutes. For outlying towns we provide a realistic ETA and keep you updated en route.

faqs.question: Can you help me shut off the water remotely?
faqs.answer: If you know where your main valve is we can walk you through shutting it off by phone. If not, a tech will locate it immediately upon arrival.

title: Drain Cleaning
excerpt: Keep your drains flowing with thorough clearing and preventative treatment.

hero.headline: Kick recurring clogs for good.
hero.subheadline: We pair mechanical cleaning with camera inspections to solve the actual cause, not just clear what’s in reach.

problems: Kitchen sink or dishwasher backups and bad odors
Slow bathtubs or showers that pool water at your feet
Laundry standpipes overflowing mid-cycle
Main sewer lines backing up floor drains or toilets
symptoms: Gurgling drains and air bubbles when other fixtures run
Sewage smells coming from rarely used drains
Water stains near basement floor drains
Recurring clogs right after snaking with consumer tools
solutions: Cable machine clearing for heavy build-up and wipes
Hydro-jetting to scour grease, scale, and soap residue
Bio-enzyme treatments to keep lines healthy post-cleaning
Video inspection with footage shared so you can see the fix
expectations: We protect surrounding areas before starting and clean up fully after
Technicians explain what we removed and how to prevent the issue
Written warranty for the line cleaned when proper access is available
Upfront pricing based on access points and equipment required

faqs.question: Will you use chemicals to clear the drain?
faqs.answer: No harsh acids. We rely on mechanical cleaning and safe enzyme treatments so pipes and septic systems stay intact.

faqs.question: How do I know if the clog is in the main line?
faqs.answer: If multiple fixtures back up at once, especially lower level drains, it’s usually the main. We confirm with a camera before any major work.

faqs.question: Do you offer maintenance plans?
faqs.answer: Yes. Annual or semi-annual jetting keeps commercial kitchens and busy households flowing. We’ll customize a schedule for you.

title: Leak Detection & Repair
excerpt: Stop hidden leaks before they damage drywall, flooring, or foundations.

hero.headline: Find the drip. Fix it right.
hero.subheadline: Our techs use acoustic tools, thermal imaging, and experience to locate tough leaks with minimal drywall cuts.

problems: Slab leaks raising water bills and warming flooring
Ceiling stains from second-floor bathrooms or laundry rooms
Persistent running toilets and fill valves wasting water
Leaking hose bibbs or outdoor lines causing foundation issues
symptoms: Higher water bills without any change in usage
Musty smells, paint bubbling, or warped baseboards
Water meter spinning even when fixtures are off
Sump pit cycling with no rain present
solutions: Pressure testing and isolation to pinpoint the leaking line
Thermal imaging and acoustic equipment to avoid tearing into walls blindly
Spot repairs or reroutes using PEX, copper, or CPVC depending on the home
Moisture mitigation guidance and referrals for restoration when needed
expectations: We treat your home like our own, using clean drop cloths and shoe covers
Detailed explanation of repair options before any opening is made
Permanent fix with new materials and tested connections
Warranty on labor and materials supplied by Simple Man Plumbing

faqs.question: Can you work with my insurance company?
faqs.answer: Yes. We can provide documentation, photos, and communicate directly with adjusters to help move your claim forward.

faqs.question: Will you need to open up walls?
faqs.answer: When leaks hide behind finishes we make surgical openings and minimize disruption. We’ll recommend trusted restoration partners for patching.

faqs.question: Do you install water monitoring systems?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Smart shutoff valves and leak sensors can alert you early and even shut the water off automatically.

title: Water Heater Install & Repair
excerpt: Keep the hot water flowing with repairs, maintenance, and replacement options.

hero.headline: Hot water, without the guesswork.
hero.subheadline: We service all brands, stock common parts, and install new tank or tankless systems with manufacturer-backed warranties.

problems: No hot water or temperature swings when multiple fixtures run
Leaking tank threatening to flood a basement or utility closet
Pilot light failures or error codes on tankless systems
Old units pushing past 10 years and losing efficiency
symptoms: Rust colored water or sediment buildup at faucets
Popping sounds from the tank when heating
Water taking longer to recover after showers
Gas or exhaust smells near the water heater
solutions: Full diagnostics, flushes, and anode replacement to extend life
Same-day tank swaps with haul-away and code upgrades
High-efficiency tankless installations sized for your household
Annual maintenance plans with descaling and performance checks
expectations: Transparent comparison of repair vs. replacement costs
Proper venting, expansion tank, and drain pan installed to code
Permit handling and inspections where required
Cleanup of all debris with instructions on care and warranty

faqs.question: Do you offer financing on new water heaters?
faqs.answer: Yes. We partner with financing providers to offer promotional 0% APR for qualified replacements.

faqs.question: How long does a replacement take?
faqs.answer: Most standard tank swaps are finished in 3–4 hours. Tankless conversions may take a full day depending on venting and gas line upgrades.

faqs.question: Will you remove and recycle my old heater?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Every replacement includes haul-away and responsible recycling of your old unit.

title: Sump Pumps
excerpt: Keep basements dry with reliable pumps, back-ups, and regular testing.

hero.headline: Stay ahead of spring storms.
hero.subheadline: Simple Man Plumbing installs, replaces, and maintains sump and ejector pumps that keep Indiana basements dry.

problems: Primary sump pump failure during storms
Backup pump batteries dead or missing entirely
Noise, vibration, or short-cycling pumps
Ejector pit odors coming from basements or utility rooms
symptoms: Water lingering in the crock even when the pump runs
Rusty or corroded pump components
Breaker tripping when the pump turns on
Basement humidity spikes and musty smells
solutions: High-output Zoeller and Liberty pump installations
Battery or water-powered backups with monitoring alerts
Check valve replacement and discharge pipe upgrades
Annual maintenance with crock cleaning and performance testing
expectations: We spec the right pump for your pit depth and groundwater level
Neat piping with unions for future maintenance
Battery backups tested and homeowner instructed on alarms
Warranty paperwork provided with maintenance schedule

faqs.question: Do you offer maintenance plans?
faqs.answer: Yes. We’ll test the pump, clean the crock, and replace batteries before storm season hits.

faqs.question: Can you add a backup pump to my existing system?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We can retrofit battery backups or even smart monitoring to most pits.

faqs.question: What brands do you install?
faqs.answer: We trust Zoeller and Liberty for their durability and readily available parts in our region.

title: Faucets, Toilets & Fixtures
excerpt: Updates and repairs that modernize your kitchen or bath without the mess.

hero.headline: Fresh fixtures, professionally installed.
hero.subheadline: From disposals to freestanding tubs, we make fixture upgrades easy with tidy workmanship.

problems: Leaking faucets wasting water and staining sinks
Running toilets or cracked tanks needing replacement
Garbage disposals jammed or leaking
Shower valves sticking or fluctuating temperatures
symptoms: Water dripping constantly even after tightening handles
Toilets refilling on their own or phantom flushing
Under-sink water damage from fixture supply lines
Outdated chrome fixtures bringing down your remodel
solutions: On-truck stock of common cartridges and repair kits
Toilet rebuilds or efficient replacements with haul-away
Garbage disposal installs wired and tested to code
Custom fixture installs homeowners source from their showroom
expectations: We protect countertops and flooring before work begins
Every joint tested and inspected with you before we leave
Old fixtures removed or left for you—your choice
Clear care instructions and warranty information provided

faqs.question: Can you install fixtures I purchased myself?
faqs.answer: Yes. We’re happy to install homeowner-supplied fixtures as long as they’re in good condition and meet code.

faqs.question: Do you handle minor carpentry or drywall after?
faqs.answer: We patch small openings behind toilets or vanities. For larger drywall/tiling we can refer trusted partners.

faqs.question: Will you check for other issues while you’re here?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Every visit includes a quick home plumbing check and we’ll point out anything that needs attention.
